transit_regulations.name: No restrictions (EU)
transit_regulations.conditions: No special special requirements for transit apply.

transit_regulations.name: Passenger Locator Form (BE)
transit_regulations.conditions: You must fill out a self-assessment form within 48 hours before arrival.
transit_regulations.title: Online Form

entry_regulations.name: No restrictions (EU)
entry_regulations.conditions: No special special requirements upon entry apply.

entry_regulations.name: 3G/TGV (PCR or antigen test) (EU)(DE)
entry_regulations.conditions: Present a negative rapid antigen or PCR covid test result, a recovery certificate or a vaccination certificate.

entry_regulations.name: 3G/TGV (PCR test) (EU)
entry_regulations.conditions: Present a negative PCR covid test result, a recovery certificate or a vaccination certificate.

entry_regulations.name: Health declaration (NL)
entry_regulations.conditions: You need to fill out a health declaration before boarding.
entry_regulations.title: Online Declaration

entry_regulations.name: Health declaration AND 3G/TGV (NL)
entry_regulations.conditions: Present a negative rapid antigen or PCR covid test result, a recovery certificate or a vaccination certificate. You need to fill out a health declaration before boarding.
entry_regulations.title: Online Declaration

entry_regulations.name: PLF (BE)
entry_regulations.conditions: You must fill out a self-assessment form within 48 hours before arrival.
entry_regulations.title: Online Form

entry_regulations.name: PLF AND 3G/TGV (BE)
entry_regulations.conditions: Present a negative PCR test result, a recovery certificate or a vaccination certificate. You must fill out a self-assessment form within 48 hours before arrival.
entry_regulations.title: Online Form

entry_regulations.name: 3G/TGV (FR) SAFE country
entry_regulations.conditions: You have to present a vaccination proof and a sworn COVID-19 declaration. Alternatively you can present a negative result of a PCR test taken less than 72h ago or a recovery certificate.

entry_regulations.name: 3G/TGV (FR) RISK country
entry_regulations.conditions: You have to present a vaccination proof and a sworn COVID-19 declaration or alternatively a negative result of a PCR test taken less than 24h ago or a recovery certificate.

vaccine_regulations.name: Belgium, vaccination validity
vaccine_regulations.conditions: Proof of vaccination is valid on the 14th day after the full vaccination or the 1st out of 2 doses in case of recovery within 6 months of an infection.

vaccine_regulations.name: Belgium, approved vaccines
vaccine_regulations.conditions: Accepted vaccines: Pfizer / Moderna / AstraZeneca / Janssen

vaccine_regulations.name: Luxembourg, vaccination validity
vaccine_regulations.conditions: Proof of vaccination is valid in case of 2 doses from the day of the 2nd dose; on the 14th day after the vaccination in case of 1 dose or the 1st out of 2 doses in case of recovery within 6 months of an infection.

vaccine_regulations.name: Luxembourg, approved vaccines
vaccine_regulations.conditions: Accepted vaccines: Pfizer / Moderna / AstraZeneca / Janssen

vaccine_regulations.name: Netherlands, vaccination validity
vaccine_regulations.conditions: Proof of vaccination is valid on the 14th day after full vaccination; on the 28th day in case of vaccination with Janssen.

vaccine_regulations.name: Netherlands, approved vaccines
vaccine_regulations.conditions: Accepted vaccines: Pfizer / Moderna / AstraZeneca / Janssen / Covishield / Sinopharm BIBP / Sinovac

vaccine_regulations.name: France, vaccination validity
vaccine_regulations.conditions: Proof of vaccination is valid on the 7th day after full vaccination or after  a single dose of vaccine for people who recovered from a previous COVID-19 infection; on the 28th day in case of vaccination with Janssen.

vaccine_regulations.name: France, approved vaccines
vaccine_regulations.conditions: Accepted vaccines: Pfizer / Moderna / AstraZeneca / Janssen

vaccine_regulations.name: Germany, vaccination validity
vaccine_regulations.conditions: Proof of vaccination is valid on the 14th day after full vaccination or on the 14th day after a single vaccine dose in case of recovery from previous COVID-19 infection.

vaccine_regulations.name: Germany, approved vaccines
vaccine_regulations.conditions: Accepted vaccines: Pfizer / Moderna / AstraZeneca / Janssen

local_regulations.name: Belgium: outdoor
local_regulations.conditions: Outdoors: You have to wear a mask on public transport.

local_regulations.name: Belgium: outdoor AND different_household
local_regulations.conditions: Outdoors: You have to wear a mask on public transport and keep a 1,5m distance with others on the outdoors. You can sit with 7 other people at cafés.

local_regulations.name: Belgium: indoor
local_regulations.conditions: Indoors: You have to wear a facemask at indoor activities open to the public.

local_regulations.name: Belgium: indoor AND different_household
local_regulations.conditions: Indoors: You have to wear a facemask at indoor activities open to the public and keep a 1.5m distance with others. You can sit with 7 other people at cafés.

local_regulations.name: Luxembourg: outdoor
local_regulations.conditions: Outdoors: You have to wear a mask on public transport.

local_regulations.name: Luxembourg: outdoor AND different_household
local_regulations.conditions: Outdoors: You have to wear a mask on public transport and if you are in a gathering of more than 10 people. In the last case, you have to keep a 2m distance with others. You can sit with 9 other people outside cafés and restaurants without CovidCheck system.

local_regulations.name: Luxembourg: indoor
local_regulations.conditions: Indoors: You have to wear a facemask at indoor activities open to the public.

local_regulations.name: Luxembourg: indoor AND different_household
local_regulations.conditions: Indoors: You have to wear a facemask at indoor activities open to the public and if you are in a gathering of more than 10 people. In the last case, you have to keep a 2m distance with others.  You can sit with 3 other people inside cafés and restaurants without CovidCheck system.

local_regulations.name: Netherlands: outdoor
local_regulations.conditions: Outdoors: You have to wear a mask on public transport, at stations and airports.

local_regulations.name: Netherlands: outdoor AND different_household
local_regulations.conditions: Outdoors: You have to wear a mask on public transport, at stations and airports and keep a 1,5m distance with others on the outdoors.

local_regulations.name: Netherlands: indoor
local_regulations.conditions: Indoors: No special regulations apply.

local_regulations.name: Netherlands: indoor AND different_household
local_regulations.conditions: Indoors: You should keep a 1,5m distance in the buildings with others.

local_regulations.name: Belgium: open places
local_regulations.conditions: Non-essential shops are open. Hotels, cafés and restaurants are open with sanitary rules applicable inside. All cultural establishments are open.

local_regulations.name: Luxembourg: open places
local_regulations.conditions: Non-essential shops are open. Hotels, cafés and restaurants are open; however, sanitary rules apply inside places without CovidCheck system. All cultural establishments are open.

local_regulations.name: Netherlands: open places
local_regulations.conditions: Non-essential shops are open. Hotels, cafés and restaurants are open; however, registration and a health check are mandatory. All cultural establishments are open.

local_regulations.name: France: outdoor
local_regulations.conditions: Outdoors: You have to wear a mask on public transport. The distance of 2m should be maintained everywhere in public places.

local_regulations.name: France: indoor
local_regulations.conditions: Indoors: Masks are compulsory in enclosed public places. In restaurants, cafés and bars maximum of 10 people per table can sit together.

local_regulations.name: France: open places
local_regulations.conditions: Restaurants, hotels and other tourist facilities are open and require a Covid-19 certificate for entry. All shops are open and are in free access.

local_regulations.name: Germany: outdoor
local_regulations.conditions: Outdoors: You must wear a medical face mask in all public transport and outside places where 1.5m distance cannot be maintained.

local_regulations.name: Germany: indoor
local_regulations.conditions: Indoors: You must wear a medical mask in public buildings and shops. A Covid-19 certificate is needed to access a wide range of indoor facilities including restaurants, events, hospitals, etc. Specific regulations may apply in each federal state.

local_regulations.name: Germany: open places
local_regulations.conditions: Regarding open places, specific regulations for each federal state are available at the Federal Tourism Competence Centre.

children_exceptions.name: Belgium: entry rules for children
children_exceptions.conditions: Travellers below 12 years old do not need to present a Covid test result or vaccination certificate on entry.

children_exceptions.name: Belgium: local rules for children
children_exceptions.conditions: Children below 13 years old do not need to wear the facemasks.

children_exceptions.name: Luxembourg: entry rules for children
children_exceptions.conditions: Children younger than 12 years old travelling by air do not need to be tested for covid or vaccinated to enter the country.

children_exceptions.name: Luxembourg: local rules for children
children_exceptions.conditions: Children less than 6 years old are not required to wear masks in public spaces.

children_exceptions.name: Netherlands: entry rules for children
children_exceptions.conditions: Childeren younger than 13 years old do not need to present negative Covid test results or vaccination certificates on entry.

children_exceptions.name: France: entry rules for children
children_exceptions.conditions: Childeren younger than 12 years old do not need to present negative Covid test results or vaccination certificates on entry.

children_exceptions.name: France: local rules for children
children_exceptions.conditions: Children under 12 years old do not need a Covid-19 certificate to access places and are not required to wear facemasks.

children_exceptions.name: Germany: entry rules for children
children_exceptions.conditions: Childeren younger than 12 years old do not need to present negative Covid test results or vaccination certificates on entry.

children_exceptions.name: Germany: local rules for children
children_exceptions.conditions: Children under 6 years of age do not need to wear facemasks.
